title: UK weather forecast: Britain to be ravaged by four days of thunder after sunny spell

The UK is set to be ravaged by four days of thundery downpours after a brief break from the October washout today.

The recent spell of wet weather is expected to pause this afternoon as much of the country basks in sunshine.

However, the change in conditions will be short-lived as thundery showers and rain return on Thursday.

The Met Office predicts lightning in various parts of the country every day from Thursday until Monday.

(Image: SWNS)

The Environment Agency has nine flood warnings and 56 alerts in force today, although the risk of flooding should subside as conditions dry out this afternoon.

The warnings and alerts are spread across England, from the south-west to the north-east.

A spokesman for netweather.tv said: "A large area of low pressure out in the Atlantic will creep towards the north-west of Ireland on Thursday.

"(This) will bring a strengthening southwesterly wind across the west and also bring increasing showers or longer spells of rain across western areas through the day.

"Some showers also pushing in across southern counties and perhaps the Midlands.

"However, eastern areas of England and Scotland could stay dry and sunny until later in the day... even here (we) could see showers arrive in the evening."

Temperatures today will peak at 16C, dropping to lows of 5C in parts of Scotland.

This evening will be mostly dry with clear skies, although cloud and rain may linger for a time across Shetland.

Through the night conditions will remain dry with clear skies for most, although scattered showers are likely later in the west.

Tomorrow morning will be dry with sunny spells for many northern and eastern areas.

However there will be patchy cloud and showers for Irish Sea and English Channel coasts.

Through the afternoon, showers in the west will become increasingly heavy.

Friday looks unsettled too with further downpours, which may merge at times to form longer spells of rain.

There will be strong winds, especially in the south.

On Saturday there will be patchy cloud and showers in the north and west.

It is expected to be mostly dry and bright in the south and east.

Met Office five-day weather forecast

Today:

Many areas starting cloudy with rain, heavy in places. Brighter skies across Northern Ireland and parts of southwest Britain following to all but parts of southeast England and northeast Scotland. Scattered showers will affect Northern Ireland and western Scotland.

Tonight:

Remaining rain clearing, leaving many areas clear and rather chilly; a few fog patches in the north and east. Showers in parts of the west will tend to turn heavier

Thursday:

Sunshine at times for most, especially in the north and east. However showers will become more frequent and heavier, mainly in parts of the south and west, perhaps with thunder.

Outlook for Friday to Sunday:

Breezy and unsettled Friday and Saturday, with heavy showers, especially in the south and west. Showers becoming confined to southern areas Sunday, with perhaps more persistent rain in the north.
description: The Met Office predicts four days of thundery weather in the UK, with the first lightning strikes expected tomorrow
